meaning: The act of coming up.
example: The Federal budget lays out government spending for the upcoming budget year.

meaning: An upward grade or slope.
example: With my phone company, I get a free upgrade every twelve months if I keep topping up 10 pounds a month.

meaning: An upper storey.
example: They can sleep in the upstairs bedroom.

meaning: Requiring immediate attention.
example: An urgent appeal was sent out for assistance.

meaning: With great haste, with a sense of urgency, because it is very important.
example: Funds are urgently required if this work is to be completed as planned.

meaning: The manner or the amount of using; use.
The state or condition of being useful; usefulness.
example: I've bought a new disk utility that can recover deleted files.

meaning: An unoccupied position or job.
Not occupied; empty.
example: a vacant stare

meaning: To move out of a dwelling, either by choice or by eviction.
example: I have to vacate my house by midday, as the new owner is moving in.

meaning: Freedom from some business or activity.
example: The Conservative Party’s vacation of the centre ground gave an opportunity to its opponents.

meaning: A region of space that contains no matter.
example: a vacuum of 26 inches of mercury, or 13 pounds per square inch

meaning: Well grounded or justifiable, pertinent.
example: I will believe him as soon as he offers a valid answer.

meaning: To render valid.
example: The data file cannot be imported because it doesn't validate.

meaning: Any tropical, climbing orchid of the genus Vanilla (especially Vanilla planifolia), bearing podlike fruit yielding an extract used in flavoring food or in perfumes.
example: You can tell that the secret ingredient missing from New CokeTM was vanilla, because certain South American economies collapsed when it was introduced, and miraculously revived when the old formula was used again.

meaning: An upright open container used mainly for displaying fresh, dried, or artificial flowers.
A person who does not eat animal flesh, or, in some cases, use any animal products.
example: I have a vegetarian brother

meaning: The act of vending or selling; a sale.
A person or a company that vends or sells.
example: I distributed my application with a vendored copy of Perl so that it wouldn't use the system copies of Perl where it is installed.

meaning: A theater, auditorium, arena, or other area designated for sporting or entertainment events.
(grammar) A verb form which does not function as a predicate, or a word derived from a verb. In English, infinitives, participles and gerunds are verbals.
example: a verbal contract

meaning: To substantiate or prove the truth of something
A conference held by video link. An arranged video phone call between more than two parties.
example: The four of us should hold a video conference next week.

meaning: To break or disregard (a rule or convention).
example: Accessing unauthorized files violates security protocol.

meaning: The act or an instance of violating or the condition of being violated.

A musical four-string instrument, generally played with a bow or by plucking the string, with the pitch set by pressing the strings at the appropriate place with the fingers; also any instrument of the violin family.
example: The first violin often plays the lead melody lines in a string quartet.

meaning: A permit to enter and leave a country, normally issued by the authorities of the country to be visited.

Any of a specific group of organic compounds essential in small quantities for healthy human growth, metabolism, development, and body function; found in minute amounts in plant and animal foods or sometimes produced synthetically; deficiencies of specific vitamins produce specific disorders.
A game played on a rectangular court between two teams of two to six players which involves striking a ball back and forth over a net.
A piece of paper that entitles the holder to a discount, or that can be exchanged for goods and services.
A male or female attendant who serves customers at their tables in a restaurant, café or similar.
example: Waiter! There's a fly in my soup.

meaning: A female attendant who serves customers in a restaurant, café, or similar.
To relinquish (a right etc.); to give up claim to; to forego.
example: If you waive the right to be silent, anything you say can be used against you in a court of law.

meaning: A clearly defined path for pedestrians.
A small case, often flat and often made of leather, for keeping money (especially paper money), credit cards, etc.
example: The thief stole all the money and credit cards out of the old man's wallet.

meaning: A warden; a guard; a guardian or watchman.
A place for storing large amounts of products. In logistics, a place where products go to from the manufacturer before going to the retailer.
example: the warehousing of syndicated TV shows

meaning: A guarantee that a certain outcome or obligation will be fulfilled; security.
example: I made sure to check the terms of my warranty for my computer to ensure I was covered in case it broke down.

meaning: A single hypertext document (transmitted as HTML) on the World Wide Web, often hyperlinked to others, and intended to be viewed with a web browser.
example: Be sure to check out my web page on the Internet when you get home.

meaning: A collection of interlinked web pages on the World Wide Web that are typically accessible from the same base URL and reside on the same server.
A day of the week except those which form the weekend; that is:
The quality or state of being in good health.
